title: ICE when lambda captures unsized local.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code This is a simplified example taken from the [unstable rust book](https://doc.rust-lang.org/beta/unstable-book/language-features/unsized-locals.html). ```Rust #![feature(unsized_locals)] trait Example {} struct Foo(); impl Example for Foo {} fn example() -> Box { Box::new(Foo()) } fn main() { let x: dyn Example = *example(); (move || { // ERROR let _y = x; })(); } ``` ### Meta I'm getting this both on my system's rustc: `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0-nightly (0035d9dce 2021-08-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 0035d9dcecee49d1f7349932bfa52c05a6f83641 commit-date: 2021-08-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.56.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` and also the same issue on commit b6e334d87349502766be70d649e6fe4a73573482. ### Error output From my dev build: ``` warning: the feature `unsized_locals` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> test.rs:1:12 | 1 | #![feature(unsized_locals)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default = note: see issue #48055 for more information error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir/src/interpret/eval_context.rs:659:18: size_and_align_of::<[closure@test.rs:15:5: 17:7]> not supported --> test.rs:14:9 | 14 | let x: dyn Example = *example(); | ^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /home/jesyspa/dev/rust/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1061:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.0-dev running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: #0 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `main` #1 [collect_and_partition_mono_items] collect_and_partition_mono_items end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error; 1 warning emitted ```
